input: Your statement "As our already byzantine tax code has gotten more complicated thanks to Obamacare..." makes me chuckle how every woe we have is blamed on Obamacare. Please tell me when you did your taxes this year, just what part was more complicated because of the Affordable Care Act?

input: OK, what is with this screwy part of this new comment system: I replied to my2cents with "No, it would have to be some modification of a hot air balloon to qualify.: and I get an endless loop of responding to the same post to rate that doesn't allow my post to enter the lineup. What's up with that? It's happened several times and you can NEVER get out of it.

instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of insult. If the comment is insulting output Yes, otherwise output No.
input: I agree that Trooper should have been fired.  I suspect Monegan did to.  However, the union would have filed a wrongful termination suit against the state, and that Trooper would have made a ton of money off being fired.  Is that what you want?  The union has rules on how and when Troopers can be fired.  If that state doesn't follow those rules, the employee ends up winning, even if they suck.

instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of insult. If the comment is insulting output Yes, otherwise output No.
Categorize the comment on the basis of insult. If the comment is insulting output Yes, otherwise output No.
input: Beyond BS, be it SB 21 or ACES, no tax credit law for Alaska's oil should be structured to result in NO royalty revenue. Both SB21 and ACES were pushed by the cabal of Republican legislators to create an unbalanced contract.  Simply, Alaska's royalty should be no less than the profit gained by the oil producer.  Anything less is a give-away.  Now it is not only a give-away, but an insane result of paying the oil companies to "take without compensation" oil and gas that is first owned by Alaska.  As it stands, it is a criminal theft of Alaska's resource property.  The Alaska legislature must set right the situation (an undesirable situation): otherwise, "by the time a problem becomes patently obvious, it may be almost too late to remedy it."  If not remedied in this session then the immediate solution is to REMEMBER THIS IN NOVEMBER.

instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of insult. If the comment is insulting output Yes, otherwise output No.
input: The GOP leadership has been hijacked by anti tax extremists, bought and sold by the oil industry. Meanwhile the ship is slowly sinking. I am afraid there is no real hope until these turkeys are removed from office.

instruction: Categorize the comment on the basis of insult. If the comment is insulting output Yes, otherwise output No.
input: And all the people living off the state and feds, they contribute nothing and just take. How is that fair to keep asking people who *do* work to pay more and more? A sales tax really is the fair way. Rural Alaskans need to quit whining too -- they don't contribute either but at the same time whine constantly about the cost to live in their villages when they are the ones that choose to live in a place where milk has to be flown in, and that's why it's $8 a gallon.
